Title: TD1435 - For Inclusion on a Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS) for the provision of Transport Services
Description:
Derby City Council is seeking to establish a Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS), of organisations able to provide Transport Services including Home-to-School, Special Education Needs and Social Care Transport.

The purpose of this procurement procedure is to establish the DPS Agreement between the Council and Service Provider(s) for the provision of Transport Services. Under this Agreement, transport will be provided using Hackney Carriage, Minibus and Private Hire Vehicles. Vehicles will be of various capacities (minimum 4 seats and upwards and in accordance with current Public Service Vehicle (PSV) Legislation, or Private Hire or Hackney Carriage legislation.

Round one application deadline is the 09:00 on the 29th July 2019.

Applicants must meet the minimum required qualifying criteria for entry onto the DPS and maintain the requisite criteria throughout the DPS Agreement Term. There are no other restrictions on who can or cannot join the DPS and Applicants may apply to join at any time during the lifetime of the DPS as entry remains open, other than if the Council closes the DPS for any period

The first tranche (round one) of Applicants will be appointed to the DPS by the 15th August 2019 and it is intended that Contract Opportunities will commence from that date.

Select the 'apply online' link in the bottom right hand corner of this notice, this will transfer you to the Councils e-tendering system https://www.eastmidstenders.org where you can express interest and obtain the documents, (please note we will only accept expressions of interest through the e-tendering system).. Please search for TD1435

Title: Passenger Transport Services Framework
Description:
This is a notice of a future opportunity due to be published 30 September 2019. Interested vendors are required to sign up to ProContract, the Council's e-tendering system via the London Tenders Portal.                                                                         
Bromley Council will be inviting offers from transport and taxi service providers (taxis, minibuses, coaches), as part of an upcoming opportunity to deliver these services to local residents. We are keen to secure services to support wheelchair accessibility.
The Council's Passenger Transport Services Framework will provide transport services to children, young people and adults, both with and without additional needs.
Clients could have a range of needs including; being wheelchair users and individuals with mobility needs, learning needs, sensory impairment, hidden disabilities, or a combination of these. In some cases, a passenger assistant will be required.
The type of vehicle that can be used is flexible as long as it meets the required specification.
We want to engage with suppliers who will:
- Work closely with us and understand our needs.
- Demonstrate flexibility and react quickly to changing service demands to support changes to the Council's requirements and our residents.
- Be innovative and efficient in the delivery of passenger transport services.
- Conduct their business in a socially responsible and ethical way.                                                                                         
Currently approximately 900 children, young people and adults over the age of 18 attend over 100 different venues, with 37 of these situated within the Borough and 63 are situated out of the Borough. The majority of these passengers (~75%) attend venues in the Borough. Educational establishments operate throughout the academic year from September to July with half term and term breaks. Arrival times vary from 8AM to 9AM and departure times vary from 2:30PM to 4PM. Further to this, approximately 210 adult clients attend 12 day activity venues. These services are required throughout the calendar year (closed bank holidays) and operate between 7:45AM to 10:30AM in the morning, and 2:45PM to 5:30PM in the afternoon.

Title: Ealing All Age Passenger Transport Dynamic Purchasing System
Description:
London Borough of Ealing (LBE) wish to procure a Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS) for All Age Passenger Transport for people with disabilities during January /February 2020, to commence in April 2020, for a duration of 5 years with two possibilities of two year extensions. The DPS will also be available for use by other boroughs in the West London Alliance (WLA).  
It is intended that the DPS would cover procurement of services for transporting vulnerable children and adults to a variety of schools, colleges and day centres. 
Safety and wellbeing of vulnerable people is a crucially important factor in the procurement of these services.
Currently LBE spends circa £7m per annum. Future use of the DPS cannot be specified at this stage, and volumes are not guaranteed. However as current LBE contracts for transport come to an end during 2020 and 2021, subject to governance and using a phased approach, it is envisaged that all Children's and Adult's transport routes, and ad hoc spend on taxis will be purchased via the DPS by use of e auctions or mini competitions during its proposed lifetime.
Contact Address 1: London Borough of Ealing, Perceval House

Title: Cambridgeshire & Peterborough CCG Non-Emergency Patient Transport Service (PTS) Market Information Event
Description:
Overview

Cambridgeshire & Peterborough CCG would like to invite Providers to an event that is specifically targeted at Directors, Bid Managers and Finance Leaders within the Patient Transport and Managed Service Market. This event is intended to provide potential providers with further information on the procurement process, service model, intended outcomes and the likely contractual vehicle prior to issuing the Procurement notice for the Cambridgeshire & Peterborough Patient Transport Service, which is scheduled to be published in December 2015. 

The event will also provide an opportunity to network with other providers and the commissioners.

Title: Passenger Transport Framework
Description:
The Passenger Transport Framework is a joint procurement between Bournemouth Borough Council and the Borough of Poole. Bournemouth Borough Council is leading on the procurement process. 

A Framework Agreement is an agreement that sets out the terms under which individual contracts (call offs) are let during the contract period. 

The contract will cover 3 lots; 
? Provision of Minibuses 9-16 passenger seats (including minibuses with adaptations for the transportation of passengers travelling in wheelchairs) 

? Provision of Taxis, Private Hire Vehicles or Social Cars of up to 8 passenger seats (including vehicles manufactured or adapted for the transportation of passengers travelling in wheelchairs)

? Provision of ?AdHoc Provision? of Taxis and Private Hire Vehicles for up to 8 passengers. ?Ad Hoc Provision? will include short notice and one-off bookings. 

The contracts will run between September 2016 and August 2020. Based on historical data, the total, estimated spend for the contract is £13,000,000. The spend is equally spread between both Councils over the life of the contract (£6.5m/£6.5m), however individual routes and call-offs will vary between the two Councils. The figures are estimates and the Councils can?t guarantee that this value of business can be generated during the period of the contract.
Additional Text:
Suppliers interested in this opportunity should visit www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk and express their interest by clicking on the ?login and register interest? button below. New users to the system must register first to obtain a user name and password before returning to this opportunity. Please refer to the suppliers guide ?Visiting Site for the First Time? by clicking the ?Help? button. Once suppliers have expressed their interest they can access the procurement documentation from ?My Activities? on the home page. 

The tender documents provide further details on the requirements, evaluation criteria and conditions for the contract.
To be delivered in Dorset but there will be occassions when the service will be required outside of Dorset.

Title: DPS for School Transport
Description: Derbyshire County Council is setting up a Dynamic Purchasing System for School Transport within the County. The DPS includes services for Home to School Transport and School to Swimming Transport.  These services need to be provided by licensed vehicles, including buses and coaches.  Contracts awarded under the DPS are quite varied and the required vehicle size may range from a 16-seater minibus to a 84- seater double-decker bus, depending on the contract / journey details specified.

Title: DFID 7558 Programme Management Unit for an Applied Research Programme in High Volume Transport
Description:
Actual CPV code is ‘75211200 Foreign Economic-Aid Related Services’.

DFID is seeking a service provider to provide a programme management unit (PMU) to manage the delivery of an applied research programme on High Volume Transport (HVT) along national and regional transport corridors and within cities in low income countries in Africa and South Asia (LIC).

High volume transport, in this programme, covers strategic road and rail networks from both a passenger and freight perspective. The expected main beneficiaries of the project are governments and peoples of DFID priority countries, particularly low income countries in Africa and South Asia.
Attachments: DFID 7558 Contract Notice.pdf
Additional Text:
All relevant information relating to this Contract Notice can be found on the DFID Supplier Portal where suppliers can register their interest directly.

If you are not already registered as a supplier on the DFID Supplier Portal please follow the guidance which can be found on the top left of the home page: https://supplierportal.dfid.gov.uk/selfservice/

Title: Home To School Transportation for Durham County Council
Description: Invitation to Tender for Home to School transportation for Mainstream and Special Education Needs (SENS) 2016 This contract (the Contract) is for the provision for home to school transportation to take passengers to Mainstream Schools and Special Education Needs schools and any other destinations which may fall under the requirements. The primary objective is for the provision for various home to school transport, this includes various sized vehicles from taxis ranging through to mini and full sized buses.

Title: Leicestershire Transport and Land Use Planning and Modelling Consultancy Services Framework
Description:
The purpose of this tender is to allow Leicestershire County Council to undertake a procurement to identify and appoint several consultants onto a framework agreement for the provision of comprehensive transport planning and policy, modelling, engineering and technical advice.  The primary purpose of the advice will be to support the Council in its use of its four-stage Land-Use/Transport Interaction (LUTI) model (this is called Leicester and Leicestershire Integrated Transport Model (LLITM)). Other advice such as the formation of rail, road and aviation policy, microsimulation modelling, auditing, and environmental assessments are also covered by this tender. 

The framework agreement will be divided into five lots which are described later in this notice.
Whilst predominantly used by the Council, the framework will also be open for use by other local authorities,developers and other relevant organisations approved and authorised by Leicestershire County Council which are covered by the new expanded area of LLITM.

Title: WP3279 - Application to join a Dynamic Purchasing System for the provision of Passenger Transport Services
Description:
The Council is issuing this Application to join a DPS for the provision of Passenger Transport Services for the Council for adults and children and those with requirements as detailed in the Specification.  It is intended to commence the DPS in July-August and operate for a period of 5 years with the option to extend for a further 5 years, up to 10 years in total.   Suppliers who are reapplying or new suppliers may apply to join the DPS at any time during this period.
      
      The scope of the service includes the following categories but may be extended to include any similar services required by the Council during the period of the DPS:
      -  School Contracts for Home to school transport for children with special educational needs
      -  Route Contracts for Mainstream schools (in borough)
      -  Route Contracts for Out of borough schools
      -  Route Contracts for Respite
      -  Route Contracts for Looked after children
      -  Route Contracts for Parenting programmes
      -  Route Contracts for Adult social care
      
      The aim of the service is to provide an efficient, reliable, value for money transport service for school children and adults with additional needs, from their place of residence to the schools and/or day care services and other establishments, predominately within the Walsall borough, although some out of borough provision is required.
Additional Text:
Please note that Walsall Council have a new Contract opportunity. 

For further details of the requirement, please see the following link to the Councils` e-Procurement web portal;

https://in-tendhost.co.uk/walsallcouncil

You will be required to register your organisation (if already not done so) and express your interest in the relevant project/opportunity.

Organisation Name: Guy's and St Thomas' NHS Foundation Trust (as host of NHS London Procurement Partnership)
Title: Framework for the Provision Patient Transport Services
Description:
Guy's and St Thomas' NHS Foundation Trust (as host of the NHS London Procurement Partnership) is seeking to establish a framework for the provision of Patient Transport Services across 8 Lots and 10 Regional sub lots. The framework shall be open to LPP member bodies as listed at: http://www.lpp.nhs.uk/about-lpp/our-members/and any new LPP members for the duration of the contract; plus any other NHS/Public Sector bodies located in England, subject to approval of LPP, including but not limited to Acute and Foundation Trusts,CCGs,Ambulance, Care, Hospital, Mental Health & Community Health Trusts, Special Health Authorities, HealthBoards, NHS Commissioning Boards, CSUs and other health orgs, Community Health Councils, Local HealthBoards, Social Enterprises, NHS Collaborative Procurement Hubs / Organisations, GP Practices, Primary CareCommissioners, Local Authorities and any successor organisations of the above.Provision of Fully Managed Patient Transport Services, this lot includes the provision of all the services coveredwithin Lot 2 to Lot 8 listed for all mobility types and call centre services:
Lot 2 - Call Centre Services
Lot 3 - Patient Transport Services,
Lot 4 - Car Services including Wheelchair Accessible Vehicles (WAVs),
Lot 5 - High Dependency Unit Vehicles,
Lot 6 - Secure Vehicles,
Lot 7 - Bariatric Vehicles,
Lot 8 - GP2/GP4.
Lots 1, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 & 8 will be broken down into a further ten (10) sub-lots by region:
a) Region 1 - North East,
b) Region 2 - Yorkshire,
c) Region 3 - North West,
d) Region 4 - West Midlands,
e) Region 5 - East Midlands,
f) Region 6 - South West,
g) Region 7 - South Central,
h) Region 8 - South East,
i) Region 9 - London

Title: AHS/CS5074 Passenger Transport Services Framework 2017
Description:
Contract Title:	Provision of Passenger Transport Services 2018 Contract Ref AHS/CS 5074

The London Borough of Tower Hamlets (LBTH) is seeking expressions of interest from interested organisations for the above services and / or goods.

Description:
The contract is for the provision of Specialist Passenger Transport Services transporting vulnerable adults and children to Day centres and Schools respectively and making the return journeys to home later in the day.

Most of the requirements are for set, daily routes but a provision for additional, ad-hoc journeys is also required.

The range of vehicles necessary to provide the service will include cars, mini-buses and small coaches and providers will have to be able to meet this requirement.

Passenger assistants will be required on the majority if not all of the journeys as will the ability to board and assist passengers in wheelchairs and with other mobility difficulties.

It is intended that ten successful bidders will be appointed onto a Framework from where services will be called off for delivery via a call-off contract.

The anticipated contract start date is: 1 September 2018

The estimated value of the contract is: 	
10.8 million pounds	Total Cost

For a period of: 4 years

Organisations wishing to express their interest are requested to register on the London Tenders Portal (www.londontenders.org) where the tender documentation will be available for download. You will be required to complete a Selection Questionnaire (SQ).

The invitation to tender instructions and the specifications will be available as a public attachment allowing organisations expressing an interest in the project easy access of the main requirements. Full documentation requirements will be included within the evaluation questionnaire.

Organisations must ensure that access to the system is available to their representatives dealing with the contract.  The council will not be liable for the lack of delegated access within the organisation and will not send any documentation regarding the contract, which shall be exclusively available through the portal.

Tenderers are responsible for allowing sufficient time to submit their ITT/SQ. The Council accepts no liability whatsoever for ITT/SQs that are not submitted due to internet connectivity issues, transmission delays or errors. 

Deadline for expression of interest and return of SQ is:
Friday, 13 April 2018	12 Midday

LBTH is an Equal Opportunities Employer and a supporter of Ethical Governance, our protocol can be found here along with Guidance to Suppliers and Providers. Or via:
http://www.towerhamlets.gov.uk/ 
LBTH does not undertake to invite all applicants or bind itself to accept the lowest or any Tender.  LBTH will not be liable for any costs incurred in tendering for this contract.

If you require any further information please contact:

Andrew Shorter
at: procurement@towerhamlets.gov.uk

Title: DPS For The Provision of Home to School & Commercial Transport
Description: Tenders are invited from operators who wish to be included in the Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS) being introduced by TSS for the provision of passenger transport services for home to school, SEN & social services passengers and which includes the following sectors, Mainstream Education, SEN & Social Services passengers together with passengers carried on a commercial bases, and other transport requirements that may be added to this framework. Specific conditions of contract apply to all transport contracts offered. The period of this DPS will be 4 years plus a possible option to extend for a period of 24 months, commencing 10th June 2018, upon the conditions set out in attached documents. TSS reserves the right to award places within the DPS to an unlimited amount of suppliers. New applicants can apply to join the DPS during the course of the contract duration at periodic periods set and announced by TSS. Please note should performance fall below that which is set out within the general terms and conditions applicants may be removed from the DPS framework.

Organisation Name: Homerton University Hospital NHS Foundation Trust
Title: Non-Emergency Patient Transport Services
Description: Homerton University Hospital NHS Foundation Trust requires a Supplier to provide non-emergency patient transport services. The services will be required 24 hours a day, 7 days a week and 365 days a year. The scope of the services covers the transport of patients, who are eligible to receive the service, to and from appointments (pre-booked and same-day), collecting patients who have been discharged from their stay in Hospital and, where appropriate, transport between different clinics/premises within the Trust. The scope also covers the associated call-centre services and booking processes. Please refer to the Invitation To Tender documents available via the ProContract e-Tendering portal (www.procontract.due-north.com).

Title: Small Vehicle Passenger Transport Services (DPS SV5)
Description:
Leicestershire County Council ("the Council") provides transport for a variety of service users including those accessing Children and Young People's and Adult Social Care services. Their specific needs are co-ordinated by our in-house Transport Operations (TO) Service based at County Hall in Leicestershire. The dates are indicate that of the DPS. You can join up until any point until the end of the contract date.

As long as Suppliers can meet the minimum requirements for entry onto the DPS, there are no restrictions on who can or cannot join. There are also no restrictions on when a Supplier can apply to join during the period of the DPS.

The intention of the DPS is to appoint suitable Operators of Taxis to whom LCC will let individual Contracts following a 'further competition'; specifically:

•	The provision of both a driver and vehicle.

•	The operation of Taxis of various seating capacities.

•	The operation of Taxis of various configurations and specifications including wheelchair accessible vehicles.

•	The carriage of a variety of service users including children, vulnerable adults and those with Special Educational Needs (SEN).

•	The operation of Taxi services in and around the County of Leicestershire and City of Leicester.

•	The operation of Taxis with or without an escort, as required for individual services.

•	The operation of Demand Responsive Transport (DRT) services, including those that collect fares.

For the award criteria, please see the documentation found within the project: https://www.eastmidstenders.org/
Additional Text: please see the documentation found within the project: https://www.eastmidstenders.org/

Title: SH0491 Non Patient Courier Transport Services
Description: We are looking to source a Contractor to provide a total managed courier service for non-patient transport provided to Southern Health NHS Foundation Trust, Solent NHS Trust and other beneficiaries within the NHS Hampshire STP. The transport provision is required weekdays, weekends, bank holidays and ranges from early morning to late at night for collections and deliveries, transporting a number of different streams, including mail, parcels, pathology, pharmacy, items for sterilisation incorporating a track and trace service. Full Details of the required services are documented within the tender documents, accessed via the NHS Commercial Solutions Bravo e-Tendering Portal

Title: Home to School Transport (DPS)
Description:
Prior information notice without call for competition

 Bracknell Forest Council is looking to put in place a Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS) for the provision of a Home to school transport (HTST) service for students and young people with SEN, physical disabilities and challenging behaviour. There is also scope for general transport service including Adult Social Care requirements.  Private Hire, Mini Bus , Bus and Coaches may be required.
The provision is intended to cater for Specialised transport for educational requirements and affiliated areas along with general requirements for Business Travel , Commercial use and Public Services and will be available via DPS platform.
The structure of this DPS and full service provision will be determined as a result of the market engagement.

Title: YPO - 000949 Home to School and Safeguarding Transportation Solutions
Description: YPO are looking for a provider to be appointed onto a Framework Agreement for the provision of a mobile subscription service for transport providers & a free downloadable application for parents. The application is aimed at integrating collection and delivery points, routes, times forecast, intelligent notifications, near field communication (NFC) stickers, mobile devices / tablets and finger print recognition hardware and all information to help provide parents with the necessary safeguarding information required whilst their children are on school transport. This will also include a requirement to cover all forms of transportation of schools for children and young people with special educational needs and disability.

Title: Children's Transport Framework II
Description:
Thurrock Council is re-opening its Framework for Children's Transport Services.  It is seeking licensed operators to transport both mainstream, and children with Special Educational Needs and Disabilities (SEND) to and from school, as well as ad-hoc taxi services for children needing transport as a result of social care intervention.

Title: CP1671-18 Transportation & Engineering Professional Services
Description:
Devon County Council (DCC) is seeking an engineering consultancy organisation to provide a broad range of professional services associated with the delivery of transportation & civil engineering schemes.
The professional services organisation should expect to lead or assist with a variety of project types, including without limitation in connection with:
•	Highways, bridges & structures
•	Walking & cycling
•	Street lighting
•	Traffic management, Intelligent Transport Systems (ITS) & traffic signals
•	Waste management
•	Highway depots
•	Flood risk & coastal schemes
•	Park & ride/change
•	Public & passenger transport
•	Public realm/town centre enhancements
•	Car parks, railways & canals
•	Projects around future mobility & emerging technologies
In addition, DCC may also commission services on behalf of other second tier local authorities within the geographical Devon boundary. 
Torbay Council & Dorset Council will also have the option to enter into their own separate contracts with the successful consultant.
There is also the possibility that this contract could deliver EU funded projects during its duration.

Title: SEND & Social Care Transportation Framework
Description:
The Council is seeking to establish a Framework Agreement ("the Framework") under which the Purchasers can procure hackney carriage, private hire vehicle services and bus & coach (public service vehicles). There will be no guarantee of work under the Framework, but the Purchasers envisage that they will make considerable use of the Framework throughout its lifetime.

The Framework will cover the Council's requirements taxi, minibus and coach services. It will encompass Home to School, Home to care, College Transport, Transport for Older People, Looked After Children, People with Additional Needs, other Vulnerable People within Social Care and any other transport request as identified by the Council.

It is expected that this Framework will have multiple Contractors to maximise efficiency savings for the Purchasers. 

Contractors will be drawn from this Framework Agreement to satisfy these requirements.
Additional Text: To access the documents for this procurement opportunity please visit the North East Procurement Portal at www.nepoportal.org. Documents are under contract reference (C-011613 P-007056). Portal reference (DN456572).

Title: Tender Phase 2, 2015 - Transport Services
Description: Vehicles with drivers are required to transport clients to various locations in the East of Cheshire and surrounding areas. Detailed information of routes, days of operation, whether wheelchair accessible vehicles are required and whether passenger assistants as well as drivers are required, will be detailed in the tender documentation on the chest website.    The authority gives no guarantee or warranty or makes any representation as to the accuracy of any indicative volumes or as to the value of the work during the contract period. Title: Bus Transport Services DPS (home to school and local bus services)
Description:
This notice involves the setting up of a dynamic purchasing system.

Warwickshire County Council invites applications from suitably experienced operators for admission to their Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS) for the provision of bus transport services (home to school and local bus services).

The required vehicle size for this contract is 9 seats or more.

The Dynamic Purchasing System will be used for the provision of bus transport services for home to school and local bus services. Passenger assistants may be required on some routes.

Once the DPS is established, operators will be advised of the opportunities available as and when they arise— operators can then choose whether they want to bid for the requirement or not (it is not compulsory to bid for every opportunity offered, all operators within DPS will be informed of the opportunity, but can choose whether or not to bid on an individual basis).

Tender opportunities are likely to be offered either via an electronic auction (e-auction) exercise or via an electronic quote mechanism (currently In-tend).

Warwickshire County Council will be using its e-tendering system (In-Tend) for the administration of this procurement process and providers must register with the system to be able to express an interest.

The web address is: https://in-tendhost.co.uk/csw-jets

Registration and use of In-Tend is free. Once registered, all correspondence for this procurement process must be via the in-tend correspondence function. However, if you are unable to register with the website please email us at procurement@warwickshire.gov.uk
Additional Text:

Organisation Name: South, Central and West Commissioning Support Unit
Title: Somerset CCG - Non Emergency Patient Transport Service
Description:
The provision of Non-Emergency Patient Transport Services for Somerset Clinical Commissioning Group is being carried out using an Open Process.  

The County of Somerset covers a large geographical area.  It has a dispersed, mainly rural population of approximately 540,000 people, with only one in four of its residents living in one of its three largest towns; Taunton; Yeovil; and Bridgwater.   

Somerset has two acute trusts within its borders (Taunton & Somerset NHS Foundation Trust and Yeovil District Hospital NHS Foundation Trust) as well as 13 community hospitals (run by Somerset Partnership NHS Foundation Trust) and 75 GP practices. The Somerset population also relies on access to services in a number of neighbouring out of county trusts.  These journeys, referred to as Zone B journeys, are generally for services which are more specialist in nature.  

Full details of the specification, activity, scope and requirements can be found in the Contract documentation and the Specification is supported with detailed journey information, maps and background information.
Bidders must be aware of the range of settings of care and the challenges that this diversity presents in terms of the resourcing and planning processes as well as its impact on the load factor and the ratio of loaded to unloaded mileage.  Bidders should consider ways of achieving improvements against the current performance.

In constructing the tender the Commissioners have taken steps to ensure that there is an attractive, clear and robust specification and workload for bidders to respond to. 

•	The Specification excludes car journeys and PTS ambulance journeys which require the support of qualified crews
•	The Commissioners have focussed the NEPTS contract on the core ‘traditional’ PTS workload looking to utilise multi-use vehicles to deliver an efficient and effective service. 
•	Out of area journeys (Zone C) are included within the contract base but with a separate payment tariff.  
•	The Patient Transport Advice Centre and Authorised Booking staff in the Trusts will make the booking requests and manage the eligibility criteria.  

We are actively seeking flexible and solution-orientated companies who are keen to make a positive mark in the NEPTS market. 

Our 3 key success factors to achieve from this procurement are: 

•	The provision of a quality, flexible and responsive service which meets the contracted performance targets.
•	Excellent communication – IT and booking systems across the stakeholder community 
•	Sustainability – an operational model which strives for innovation and efficiency with experience of delivery

The duration of the agreement will be for 60 months, with an option to extend to up 24 months.

A bidder event has been scheduled for 10.30am Friday 8th January 2016 at:

Brympton Suite
Abbey Manor Business Centre
Preston Road
Yeovil
BA20 2EN

To registe...

Title: Provision for a Dynamic Purchasing System for Passenger Transport Services
Description: In order to make the sourcing of all transport needs more efficient & effective, the ?Authority? is seeking to create a Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS) for the provision of Passenger Transport Services.  A DPS is a completely electronic procurement system which allows authorities to make repeat purchases from the market of commonly used works, goods or services.  The Authority evaluates all PQQ submissions and admits to the DPS all those who satisfy the Authority?s minimum selection criteria.  There is no limit on the number of bidders admitted to the DPS, and all bidders who meet the Authority?s stated selection criteria will be admitted.  Bidders can apply for admission to the DPS at any time.  This means a bidder that is initially unsuccessful could re-apply if it later meets the criteria.
Additional Text:
Submission to be made as per Tender Documents
N/A

Title: VEAT - Non-Emergency Patient Transport Services
Description:
Provision of patient transport services within the areas of High Weald Lewes Havens CCG, Coastal WestSussex CCG, Crawley CCG,Horsham and Mid Sussex CCG, Brighton and Hove CCG, Hastings and Rother CCG, Eastbourne Hailsham and Seaford CCG
Type of procedure
Negotiated procedure without prior publication
No tenders or no suitable tenders/requests to participate in response to restricted procedure
Extreme urgency brought about by events unforeseeable for the contracting authority and in accordance with the strict conditions stated in the directive.

Following the original tender exercise in 2015, only one tender was received. The contract was awarded to that tenderer. Due to unforeseen issues the contract will need to be terminated early and there will be no provision of Non-Emergency Patient Transport Services. Therefore there are no suitable bids, and the CCG and the other participating CCGs cannot be left without a provider and as a consequence this contract needs to be placed urgently. 
The contract duration is the same as awarded under the initial tender process.
Following publication of this notice in OJEU (sent to OJEU 1/11/16) , the contracting authority will allow a 10-day standstill period prior to entering into the contract, pursuant to regulation 99(3)(c) of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015.

Title: NHS East Riding of Yorkshire CCG - Provision of Patient Transportation Services (NEMTS)
Description:
NHS East Riding of Yorkshire Clinical Commissioning Group (hereafter the Commissioning Organisation) is seeking to commission a non-emergency medical transport service through an open procurement process. Title: Passenger Transport Service using a Taxi or Private Hire Car DPS
Description:
This notice involves the setting up of a dynamic purchasing system.

Warwickshire County Council invites applications from suitably experienced operators for admission to their Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS) for the provision of a passenger transport service using a taxi or private hire car.

The required vehicle size for this contract is no more than 8 seats.

The period of validity of the DPS will be 7 years from commencement.

The DPS will be used for the provision of a passenger transport service using a taxi or private hire car.

Passenger Assistants may be required on some routes.

Once the DPS is established, operators will be advised of the opportunities available as and when they arise - operators can then choose whether they want to bid for the requirement or not. (It is not compulsory to bid for every opportunity offered, all operators on the DPS will be informed of the opportunity, but can choose whether or not to bid on an individual basis).

Tender opportunities are likely to be offered either via an electronic auction (e-auction) exercise or via an electronic quote mechanism (currently In-tend).

The current estimated annual contract value is circa £9M (GBP) per annum. This value is provided for estimation purposes only and is subject to change.

Operators should 'self-certify' their compliance with the selection requirements and confirm that none of the grounds for exclusion apply in order to gain admittance to the DPS. 

Operators who are successful at this stage will be admitted to the DPS.

Once the DPS is established the Council will invite all operators on the DPS to submit prices to operate specific route/s as and when they become available - operators can choose if they want to bid for the requirement or not.
Additional Text:
The Contracting Authority has identified that the scope of this procurement falls within a business sector which may be attractive to infiltration by organised crime groups. The Contracting Authority therefore reserves the right to include enhanced probity checks / requirements at both the selection and award stages of the procurement.

Warwickshire County Council will be using its e-tendering system (In-Tend) for the administration of this procurement process and providers must register with the system to be able to express an interest.

The web address is: https://in-tendhost.co.uk/csw-jets

Registration and use of In-Tend is free. Once registered, all correspondence for this procurement process must be via the in-tend correspondence function. However, if you are unable to register with the website please email us at procurement@warwickshire.gov.uk

Title: Non-Emergency Patient Transport Services for Bedfordshire, Luton and Hertfordshire
Description:
Non-Emergency Patient Transport Services (NEPTS) for NHS Herts Valleys Clinical Commissioning Group, NHS Luton Clinical Commissioning Group, NHS Bedfordshire Clinical Commissioning Group, and NHS East and North Hertfordshire Clinical Commissioning Group. 

A procurement process was initiated by Luton and Bedfordshire Clinical Commissioning Groups on 1 September 2017 (OJEU reference 2017/S 167-343841). A separate procurement process was initiated by Hertfordshire Clinical Commissioning Groups on 18 September 2017 (OJEU reference 2017/S 179-366553).
Both contracts resulting from the procurement were due to 'go live' on 1st April 2018.
Due to unforeseen circumstances, the incumbent provider Private Ambulance Service (PAS) has gone into administration, and is no longer trading, therefore there was a significant risk that there would be no provision of non-emergency patient transport services across Bedfordshire, Luton and Hertfordshire jeopardising the health and well-being of patients (to a potentially fatal degree). Therefore this contract had to be placed urgently.
The contract duration will be for an initial 2 years, starting on 13th October 2017, with the option to extend by a further year. Maximum contract duration will be 3 years.
Given the nature of business modelling involved and the associated resource implications for the potential provider it is necessary for the contingency contract to be for a minimum 24 months, in order for this to be a financially viable proposition. Otherwise the costs of a short-term contract would be prohibitive and would potentially negatively impact on the wider health care system.

Based on a 2-year + 1 year extension, the new indicative procurement timelines (high level) would be as follows:
* Indicative timeline based on a 2 year term (contract term 13th October 2017 to 12th October 2019):
- Pre-procurement activities (incl. market engagement) from August to October 2018
- Formal Procurement Process (2 stage, 'Restricted' procedure) from November 2018 to March 2019
- Mobilisation Period from April to October 2019.

* Indicative timeline based on a 2 year term + 1 year extension (contract term 13th October 2017 to 12th October 2020):
- Pre-procurement activities (incl. market engagement) from August to October 2019
- Formal Procurement Process (2 stage, 'Restricted' procedure) from November 2019 to March 2020
- Mobilisation Period from April to October 2020.
Contact Address 1: NHS Herts Valleys Clinical Commissioning Group, Hemel One, Boundary Way

Organisation Name: Ministry of Defence, Land Equipment, Other
Title: Provision of whole aircraft charter for the transportation of military and government cargo and personnel worldwide
Description:
The Authority has a requirement for whole aircraft charter for the transportation of military cargo and personnel worldwide. The Authority requires the ability to access commercial aircrafts in order to augment its military fleet in times of operational surge or to transport exceptional loads. Suppliers are required to provide flexible access to the commercial whole aircraft charter market in a dynamic and fast moving military environment.
      
      The requirement has been split into four Lots:
      Lot 1 - Cargo 
      Lot 2 -Cargo Emergency
      Lot 3 - Passenger
      Lot 4 - Passenger Compassionate
      
      There is no limit to the number of Lots a supplier may apply to tender for. Suppliers may apply for one Lot only (except Lot 2) or for more than one Lot.  In order to apply for Lot 2 - Cargo Emergency, suppliers must successfully apply for Lot 1 Cargo. Suppliers cannot apply for Lot 2 only. 
      
      Framework Agreements will be awarded for each Lot.

Title: KMCPRP-109 - Dynamic Purchasing System for the Provision of Passenger Transport Services
Description:
THIS OPPORTUNITY IS OPEN FOR APPLICATIONS FOR THE DURATION OF THE DYNAMIC PURCHASING SYSTEM. The Council of the Borough of Kirklees (the "Council") is conducting this procurement exercise in accordance with the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 (SI 2015/102) and intends to establish a Dynamic Purchasing System ("DPS") for the provision of Passenger Transport Services on a non-exclusive basis to meet its own organisational and business needs with suitably qualified Operators including Private Hire, Hackney Carriage and PSV Vehicles (the "Service" or "Services") by which Operators (the "Operators") can become eligible to bid to provide specific competitions (or "Routes"). 
Please go to www.yortender.co.uk for further information and to access relevant documentation - please note that this Dynamic Purchasing System commences on 1st June 2018 and may conclude on 31st May 2020 with the option to take up to three (3), one (1) year extensions up to 31st May 2023 subject to continued availability of eligible Operators continuing to meet the requirements and demands of the Service. 

The Services comprise of the following requirements:
a) Route transportation of Children / Adults / Passenger Assistants to schools, colleges and day centre locations and other venues, and either back home again or to another designated point as specifically set out in each Route Sheet/ instruction;
b) Interim Cover of new journeys which are likely to continue for some time and which may eventually be converted into Routes at the discretion of the Council;
c) Emergency Provision for Service requirements at short notice; and
d) Ad-hoc Provision for occasional Service requirements.
Additional Text: Please go to www.yortender.co.uk for further information and to access the relevant documentation - please note that this Dynamic Purchasing System commences on 1st June 2018 and may conclude on 31st May 2020 with the option to take up to three (3), one (1) year extensions up to 31st May 2023.

Title: Non-Emergency Patient Transport Services
Description:
The NHS Clinical Commissioning Groups of Eastern Cheshire, South Cheshire, West Cheshire, Vale Royal, Warrington and Wirral have requested provision of non-emergency patient transport services to be delivered under terms of the NHS Standard Contract and to agreed service levels.

Non-Emergency Patient Transport Services (NEPTS) comprises the movement of eligible patients whose condition is not considered an 'emergency' between patients' homes, hospitals, community setting or other NHS funded treatment centres for people referred for consultations, treatments or procedures. This encompasses a wide range of vehicle types and levels of care consistent with the patients' medical needs.
Additional Text: All procurement documents are available at the below URL

Organisation Name: NHS SOUTH, CENTRAL AND WEST COMMISSIONING SUPPORT UNIT
Title: Non-Emergency Patient Transport Services for BaNES, Gloucestershire, Swindon and Wiltshire
Description:
Please note this advert has been updated to reflect a change in overall financial value. and deadline for bidder submission.



Wiltshire, Gloucestershire, Swindon and Bath and North East Somerset (BaNES) Clinical Commissioning Groups would like to invite suitably qualified providers to tender for their Non-Emergency Patient Transport Service for residents in these areas. 

Any contract let pursuant to this advert will be for an initial term of 7 years, with a possible extension of any period (or periods) up to a further 36 months, as defined and at the discretion of the Commissioner.  Services are planned to commence from 01/06/2019.

The Commissioners are seeking to replace the current commissioned Non-Emergency Patient Transport Services with one that involves:
•	A reduction in on-day/Patient flow activity
•	A reduction in call centre activity
•	A simplified payment mechanism
Bidders are advised that the Commissioners are not intending to procure an exact "like for like" for the current service. Full details of the specification, activity, scope and requirements can be found in the tender documentation.

This procurement is being carried out by NHS South, Central and West Commissioning Support Unit (SCW) on behalf of the Commissioners.  Interested providers will be able to view this notice via the 'current tenders' list on the e-procurement portal (In-tend). https://in-tendhost.co.uk/scwcsu/aspx/Home
Additional Text:
To respond to this tender bidders must register on the following e-tendering portal: https://in-tendhost.co.uk/scwcsu/

Full details of the project can be found on this portal, including instructions of how to register interest and submit a response.

Title: HIGHWAYS & TRANSPORT MAINTENANCE & CONSTRUCTION CONTRACT
Description:
Wokingham Borough Council are inviting tenders for the provision of the WBC Highways and Transport Maintenance and Construction Contract.
Wokingham Borough Council, the Employer, is a unitary authority situated in the heart of the Royal County of Berkshire, having the powers of a non-metropolitan County and District Council combined. Located approximately 30 miles west of London, Wokingham has been voted second best place in England to live (per national survey) and is made up of 3 towns and 14 parishes, each with their own distinctive character. The vibrant market town of Wokingham, the picturesque riverside villages of Sonning and Wargrave and the rural communities of Finchampstead and Remenham contrast with the modern developments of Lower Earley and Woodley. In all, the Council serves approximately 166,000 residents in 65,000 households.
Potential suppliers are invited to express their interest in participating in this Competitive Procedure with Negotiation for the Highways & Transport Maintenance and Construction Contract (MCC) for Wokingham Borough Council by submitting all the required information for qualitative selection - stage 1 of the evaluation. A formal contract will be entered into directly between Wokingham Borough Council and the selected supplier. This contract will include provision for the selected supplier to deliver similar services/works to the other Local Authorities across Berkshire and the Towns and Parishes of Wokingham on a case-by-case basis, together the "Third Parties".
In outline, the services and works to be provided by the MCC contractor are:
• Highway reactive maintenance works, safety inspections, complaints & claims management
• Routine highway maintenance including limited associated grass cutting & cleansing
• Street lighting routine and reactive maintenance & schemes
• Structural Maintenance works
• Drainage reactive, planned, jetting and gullies
• Winter Maintenance services
• Emergency response services
• Minor and Traffic Management schemes
• Sub-OJEU major infrastructure schemes including design and build options
• From April 2020, the option to include Street Cleansing Services

Title: HCC - 09/19 - The Provision of Transport Infrastructure and Planning Services
Description:
Hertfordshire is entering a period of historic growth, with 100,000 more homes, 100,000 more jobs, and a 15% increase in traffic envisaged during the next 15 years. The Council and its partners have a responsibility to plan positively for this, addressing the challenges this creates by shaping this growth to 2031 and beyond. 
      
      To this end, the Council has adopted a number of strategies outlining its response to these challenges, most notably the Local Transport Plan 4. Aiming to achieve a step change in travel behaviour by setting the framework for sustainable development and mode shift in Hertfordshire, its successful delivery requires a unified, collaborative approach both within the Council and with its partners.
      
      The services, refined through market testing, aim to provide the Council and its partners with the breadth of expertise and experience required to ensure 'good growth' in Hertfordshire. 
      
      Ranging from initial spatial planning work through to design and development of major infrastructure, as well as the modelling work, transport appraisals, and environmental assessments required in between, many of the outlined services will sit alongside in-house staff or existing providers.
      
      Please Note The TUPE Staffing Information for this procurement has been provided along with other documentation for this procurement. TUPE related information must be treated as protected data in accordance with the requirements of the Data Protection Act 1998 and must be kept confidential.   By clicking on the View Details button and accessing the documentation for this procurement, Tenderers agree:
      
      a) To undertake to treat the information as confidential and commercially sensitive at all times and take all reasonable steps to prevent any inadvertent disclosure to any third party .
      b) That under no circumstances will any of the information be disclosed by your organisation or your personnel  to any third party  without the Council's prior consent in writing.
      c) That the information supplied will be stored securely and destroyed or returned to the Council, after your Organisation's bid has been submitted or you decide not to proceed with a tender submission. 
      d) That you will indemnify the Council for any  losses,  arising from your breach or breach by any of your personnel of these confidentiality requirements specified above and data protection requirements in relation to TUPE Staffing Information.
      e) The requirements above apply whether the supplier uploads a tender response to this procurement or not.
      
      This procurement is an Open (one stage process).  Suppliers wishing to take part in this project are invited to 'express interest' which will give access to the full procurement  documents in the e-tendering system. 
      
      To be considered as a Bidder you must complete and submit a Bid by the deadline of 12.00 Noon on 25th October 2019
      
      Any questions relating to this procurement must be made via corre...
Additional Text:
Please register or log in to www.supplyhertfordshire.uk to access the suite of documentation and submit a bid

Is a Recurrent Procurement Type? : No

Title: Wiltshire Council Passenger Transport  DPS Sept 2017
Description:
Wiltshire Council (the 'Council') intends to establish a Dynamic Purchasing System to improve procurement procedures to reflect best practice and to make the procurement of Passenger Transport services as efficient as possible for both the Council and suppliers.

The Council's main aim is to appoint multiple suppliers to a Dynamic Purchasing System for the provision of passenger transport services which will be divided in to 2 lots:

Lot 1 is for vehicles 16 seats and larger;

Lot 2 will be for small and specialist vehicles below 16 seats.

Title: HAC5591  Community Transport Passenger Services DPS
Description:
Provision of specialist and caring services to meet statutory community transport for vulnerable children, youths and adults, most of whom are not in a position to care for themselves. Therefore, passengers will be reliant on the care and vigilance of all staff, regardless of whether they are a driver or a passenger assistant. The Council is holding a 'Supplier Market Testing' Event to engage with Suppliers able to deliver the Services and discuss the proposed requirements and procurement process.
For avoidance of doubt this is not a call for competition at this stage, the purpose is to advise the market on the forthcoming procurement and seek ideas from the market that may inform the final specification. The event will take place on Friday 1st November 2019.
Venue: Mulberry Place, 5 Clove Crescent, London E14 2BG.
Time: 12:30pm to 14:30pm
Please note you must register to attend.
Please send expressions of interest to attend to procurement quoting 'passenger transport': onprocurement@towerhamlets.gov.uk . by no later than 29th October 2019
Additional Text:
Organisations wishing to participate in the future opportunity are requested to register on the London Tenders Portal (www.londontenders.org) where the opportunity documentation will be available for download. Organisations must ensure that access to the system is available to their representatives dealing with the project and that this contact is updated as and when required.
The majority of the transport opportunities sourced through the DPS will be required mainly for the following reasons:
1.	for Special Educational Needs and Disability (SEND) children/young persons, transport will be required to and from home to school/college, 
2.	for adult's, transport will be required in order for them to access community support service, respite centres and other provision, 
3.	other transport requirements for children's services, and adult social care.

Title: PAN2061 - Vulnerable Passenger Transport Services Framework
Description:
Leicester City Council (the Council) invites Tenders for the provision of vulnerable passenger transport services.
The proposed Framework Agreement will be for two years with an option to extend for a period or periods totalling no more than a further two years.  We anticipate that 20 Providers shall be awarded a place on Framework Agreement. 
The Council procures journeys for children, young people and adult service users, as well as for Council staff using taxi providers.  These journeys are commonly planned e.g. trips to and from school or unplanned e.g. one-off journeys to an appointment. These taxi journeys supplement those provided by the Council's fleet of in-house buses. A given service user may be transported exclusively by taxi or bus or a combination of the two.
Service users using taxis require additional support or supervision which is provided through a passenger assistant, arranged by the taxi provider.  Some service users using taxis have additional needs of the vehicle e.g. the size of vehicle or ramps and wheelchair accessibility.  Some service users need the driver and/or passenger assistant to have specialist training e.g. how to help someone with a medical condition such as epilepsy.
The service is demand led and the volume of work may therefore increase or decrease over time. In 2018-19, approximately 200,000 journeys were commissioned.

Title: Inclusion on Bury Council's Framework of Approved Operators for the provision of Home to School & College Transport
Description: Bury Council is seeking tenders from suitably qualified and experienced operators to be included on the framework agreement to provide transport for children and young adults with special educational needs to schools and colleges both within and outside the borough of Bury. The passengers using this service will have a range of additional needs; learning difficulties, behavioural difficulties, sensory, hearing and visual difficulties, autistic spectrum disorder or physical disability. A passenger escort will be allocated to a schedule where required to accompany the passengers on their journey to and from school or college. However, some passengers are able to travel unaccompanied.  The contract is for the period 1 September 2015 to 31 August 2018 with an option to extend for a further twelve months.  Please see the attached contract information for further details.
Additional Text: To express an interest in the contract and gain access to the tender documentation please log in to www.the-chest.org.uk

Title: Generation 3 Framework One Civil Engineering, Highways and Transportation Infrastructure Works 2016 – 2020
Description:
Hampshire County Council invites applications from suitably experienced organisations who wish to be
considered for selection to tender for the Generation 3 Civil Engineering, Highways and Transportation
Infrastructure Works Framework One 2016 to 2020.
The purpose of this Tender is to procure a framework of Suppliers to provide general highway improvement
works, minor structural improvement works, public authority civil engineering works and associated small value
construction work up to an individual project value of £450,000.
The Framework will commence on 01/04/2016 and will be for a period of 48 months.
Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/
hampshire, and complete and submit the Pre-Qualification Questionnaire (PQQ) together with any supporting
information requested by 14:00 on 21/09/2015.

How to obtain the PQQ / Tender Documents

The PQQ can be accessed when logged into to In-Tend by selecting ‘View Details’ on the relevant tender advert
and clicking the ‘Express Interest’ tab. Once in the tender there are five tabs – ‘Tender’, ‘PQQ – documents’,
Correspondence’, ‘Clarifications’ and ‘History’. Select the 2nd tab (PQQ) where you will find useful information
under ‘Tender Details’ continue to scroll down to the heading ‘Tender Documents Received’ where you will be
able to view / download the documents.
Further Guidance
In addition, guidance on how to participate in a tender – download & upload documents / returns and if required,
register your company (free of charge), can be found on the In-Tend site under the ‘Help’ or ‘information for
Suppliers’ buttons.
It is intended to issue successful applicants with final tender documents in late October. The deadline for
submission of tender responses will be November 2015.
Receiving Notification Emails
To ensure you receive email alerts and notifications from our system, please add the email domain ‘@intend.
co.uk’ to your Safe Senders list.
Additional Text: Is a Recurrent Procurement Type? : No https://in-tendhost.co.uk/Hampshire/aspx/

Title: PAN1158 - Vulnerable passenger transport
Description: Leicester City Council invites tenders for the provision of passenger transport services for vulnerable adults and elderly people, children with special educational needs, patient transfers and other groups of young people. A framework agreement of suitable taxi firms is being sought, divided into four lots, according to the type of journey. Service providers on the framework agreement will then be invited to quote for packages of journeys as they become available. In total there are between 5,000 and 10,000 journeys per week (accounting for around £4 million per annum) which falls by at least half during the school holidays. The proposed contract will be for one year with an option to extend for up to two further years. Lots are as follows: 1a General requirements/Council employees on Council business 1b General requirements with passenger assistants 1c Travel in a wheelchair 1d Travel in a wheelchair with passenger assistant

Title: Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS) for the Provision of Transport Services via standard minibus and wheelchair accessible minibuses
Description:
This DPS will be used to contract work ranging from single, predefined routes to multiple pre-defined routes. We may also from time to time contract work that will require operators to undertake multiple routes within a defined geographical area or to a particular site. When contracting multiple or geographical / site based routes, we may ask for the supplier to design and support the service and ensure that they manage it to deliver the outcomes, drivers and benefits of as stated in this specification.                                                                                                                                                                                           Calls for mini competition from the DPS will result in contracts for the provision of transportation for older people, adults with learning difficulties, children with special educational needs and children in care of the Council, in order that they can access day care, social care or education.                                                                                                                                                               All contractors working under this Agreement must be fully compliant with Leeds City Council's Taxi and Private Hire Licensing current conditions and regulations in relation to operators, vehicles, drivers and passenger assistants. This applies to:
	Licensed Taxi and Private Hire Operators.
	PSV Contractor License
	Other permitted operators or suppliers

Title: Supplier Engagement Exercise for Transport & Engineering Professional Services
Description:
This is not a call for competition. Devon County Council (DCC) currently have an internal Engineering Design Group (EDG) who are responsible for the design, project management, procurement, supervision and contract management for a range of infrastructure schemes across Devon. 
Since 2001, EDG has had a Transport & Engineering Consultancy Services contract allowing EDG to manage the fluctuating workload resulting from a varying capital programme and to provide specialist services unavailable in-house.
The current contract expires in March 2020. In recent years, the average annual spend with the incumbent supplier has been around £4.5million.
DCC is inviting all interested parties to complete and return the supplier engagement questionnaire to mike.sullivan@devon.gov.uk and simon.richardson@devon.gov.uk by 12:00 on 8th October 2018.

Organisation Name: NHS SOUTH, CENTRAL AND WEST COMMISSIONING SUPPORT UNIT
Title: Procurement for the provision of Neonatal Transport Services in Hampshire, Isle of Wight, Buckinghamshire, Oxfordshire, Dorset, Berkshire West and West Sussex to NHS England
Description:
NHS England Thames Valley and Wessex are seeking to re-commission their Neonatal Transport Services as the current contract is due to expire in 2020. This covers transfers across Hampshire, Isle of Wight, Buckinghamshire, Oxfordshire, Dorset, Berkshire West and West Sussex.

The Commissioner has a possible total budget available of £12,600,000 over a 7 year contract term. The initial contract term is for 7 year.  At the end of the initial contract term the Commissioners will have an extension option for a further 3 years available which will be awarded at their discretion, giving a maximum possible contract value of £18,000,000 inclusive of VAT, over 10 years if the full contract term is fulfilled. Services are scheduled to commence on 01/07/2020.

This procurement is being carried out by NHS South, Central and West Commissioning Support Unit (SCW) on behalf of the Commissioners.

COMPLETED Market Engagement Event Advert: https://www.contractsfinder.service.gov.uk/Notice/2c2ea97e-9d00-4a9c-9047-be976885f0d4
Contact Address 1: SCW CSU Procurement, Wynford House, Lufton Way, Lufton
Additional Text:
Interested providers will be able to view this notice via the 'current tenders' list on the e-procurement system In-Tend, available on the following link: https://in-tendhost.co.uk/scwcsu/aspx/Home 

In order to submit a bid, you will need to be registered on the e-procurement system and 'express an interest', and then complete a response as specified within the procurement documents. 

On registration, please include at least two contacts to allow for access to the system in times of absence.

The services are healthcare services falling within Schedule 3 to the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 ("the Regulations")  which are not subject to the full regime of the Regulations, but is instead governed by the "Light Touch Regime" contained within Chapter 3, Section 7 of the Regulations (Regulations 74 to 77).

The tendering process will be conducted in accordance with the requirements and flexibilities provided by Articles 74 to 76 of the Directive, and Regulations 74 to 76 of the Regulations. The Authority will run a transparent tender process, treating all Bidders equally. For the avoidance of doubt, the Authority will not be bound by the Regulations or the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union or any other regulations or legislation except for the specific parts or circumstances that apply to the procurement of these Services. 
  
Neither the inclusion of a Bidder selection stage, nor the use of any language or terms found in the Directive or Regulations, nor the description of the procedure voluntarily adopted by the Authority ("Open", "Restricted", "Competitive Procedure with Negotiation", "Competitive Dialogue" or any other description), nor any other indication, shall be taken to mean that the Authority intends to hold itself bound by the Directive or Regulations, save by the provisions applicable to services coming within the scope of Annex XIV of the Directive / Schedule 3 of the Regulations. 

The Contracting Authority intends to voluntarily observe the award decision notices provisions and 10 day standstill period described in Regulation 86 of the Regulations. Unsuccessful Bidders will receive scores and reasons for the decision, including the characteristics and relative advantages of the winning bid and the reasons why the Bidder/application was unsuccessful. Deadline for lodging of appeals should be in accordance with Regulation 87 and Regulation 91 of the Regulations.

Title: TC076 - DPS for The Provision of Passenger Transport Services
Description: The Borough Council of Bolton ("the Authority") is prepared to receive tenders to be included on the Dynamic Purchasing System for the Provision of Passenger Transport Services which will be subject to the information, specification and tender package enclosed. A Dynamic Purchasing System is, in effect, an open framework agreement to which new providers can apply to be appointed to during its life. During this period new providers will be able to gain entry onto the Dynamic Purchasing System. During this period, the Dynamic Purchasing System will re-open intermittently, during which periods new providers will be able to gain entry onto the Dynamic Purchasing System. It is envisaged that the Dynamic Purchasing System will be re-opened as and when there is a requirement by the Authority for further provision. The term of the Dynamic Purchasing System will be for 5 years. It is intended for the Dynamic Purchasing System to commence on 5th September 2020.

Title: United Kingdom-London: Real estate services
Description: 'Transport for London (TfL) is acting as the lead in putting in place a Framework Agreement for Property Partnerships. The Contracting Authority as defined in VI.3 is seeking to establish a multi-supplier Framework Agreement for up to 10 years. The Framework Agreement will enable the award of call-off contracts for the development of sites identified by the Contracting Authority for delivery through the formation of a Joint Venture vehicle (JV). In forming any such JV, a Supplier will be required to provide or procure the provision of funding for the development, provide development management services and, potentially, provide or procure the provision of related ancillary works and services to the Contracting Authority. The Contracting Authority has a need to develop a selection of sites that it owns in the Capital to maximise the economic value of those sites back to the Contracting Authority, in order to increase revenue. The sites vary in size and readiness for development and include, but are not limited to, buildings that offer the potential for residential conversion, mixed use or residential developments, major regeneration schemes in town centres, brownfield developments in inner and outer London and land attached to, adjacent to or over stations, depots, railways, highways, bus or other operational property and transport infrastructure. The Framework Agreement will provide the Contracting Authority with the ability to partner with Suppliers for the purposes of developing sites identified by the Contracting Authority for delivery in joint venture and obtain the benefit of the Suppliers' services and provision by Suppliers of ancillary works and services (being those which are ancillary to the relevant development). The scope of the Contracting Authority's requirements through the Framework Agreement is expected to cover all or any part of a property development cycle and will include, but not be limited to, development management services including planning services, site surveying, scheme design and specification, construction design and management, community and stakeholder management, site valuation, development appraisals, marketing, programme management and construction implementation strategy. A Supplier awarded a call-off contract may be required to supply the services either directly to the relevant Contracting Authority or to the relevant site JV. The JV may also be required to supply works or services directly to the relevant Contracting Authority In addition to providing these services, Suppliers may also be required to provide further services related to the development of proposals to develop sites including, but not limited to, the development of detailed business plans (including development appraisals) and the development of and implementation of funding strategies as part of any call-off contract. Suppliers will also be required to demonstrate that they are able to provide or procure the provision of funds to support sit

Title: Tameside Interchange - Design & Construct

This facility is referred to as Tameside Interchange and is more particularly defined within the Works Information (and the Employer's Requirements contained therein) forming part of the Invitation to Tender documentation issued alongside the Pre-Qualification Questionnaire published under the OJEU Restricted Procedure within OJEU Notice ref 2016/S 101-180181.
